active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student explains key contextual factors (e.g., geolocation, device info, behavior) used in adaptive authentication, while the partner creates and asks quiz questions or examples. Switch roles after 5 minutes. Addresses misconceptions like confusing static vs. dynamic auth.
active_learning.problem_solving: Present a real-world scenario: 'A user logs into a SaaS HR platform from a new device in an unfamiliar country at 3 AM to approve payroll.' Students design an adaptive auth policy: identify risk factors, select AALs per NIST, and outline MFA steps. Apply to cloud IAM.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding
